SENT.plain: Tricuspid atresia is one of the rarest heart defects, and it is rarely associated with prolonged survival
This paper describes the third known case of pregnancy associated with tricuspid atresia
This is the first detailed report of the clinical course of a patient with this disorder
Complications included heart failure, multiple pulmonary emboli, cerebral embolization, and premature labor
Recommendations are made regarding patient care
